name: Ellen Ochoa
summary: First Hispanic woman to go to space and former director of NASA's Johnson Space Center.
shortDescription: Ellen Ochoa is a Mexican-American astronaut and engineer, the first Latina in space. She flew on four Space Shuttle missions and later served as director of NASA's Johnson Space Center.

detailed_description.early_life: Born in Los Angeles, Ellen excelled in math and science. She earned a PhD in electrical engineering from Stanford University.
detailed_description.stem_journey: Ellen joined NASA as a research engineer and became an astronaut in 1991. She flew on four Space Shuttle missions and logged nearly 1,000 hours in space.
detailed_description.challenges: As a Latina in STEM, Ellen faced cultural and gender barriers. She persevered through determination and passion for science.
detailed_description.achievements: First Latina in space, flew on four Space Shuttle missions, and became director of Johnson Space Center.
detailed_description.legacy: Ellen's achievements inspire Latinas and women everywhere to pursue STEM careers.

achievements: Flew on four Space Shuttle missions

timeline.event: Became director of Johnson Space Center

barriers: Cultural and gender barriers in STEM
impact: Inspired Latinas and women everywhere to pursue STEM careers.

media.title: Ellen Ochoa: First Latina in Space

mentorship: Mentored students and advocated for diversity in STEM.
fun_fact: Ellen is also a classical flutist.

career_path.advice_for_students: Don't be afraid to reach for the stars and pursue your dreams.

books_for_students: Ellen Ochoa: The First Hispanic Woman Astronaut
student_resources.advice: Stay curious and keep learning about science and technology.

challenges.how_overcame: Persevered through determination and support from mentors.

education_details.high_school: Grossmont High School, La Mesa, CA
education_details.study_tips: Ask questions and seek mentors in your field.

modern_impact.current_applications: Her legacy inspires Latinas in STEM and space exploration.
modern_impact.future_implications: Future space missions and STEM outreach build on her inspiration.

cultural_background.cultural_contributions: Pioneered Latinas' participation in space exploration.
